thread.title: Group sets up racks of blessings at mosques Shelves filled with necessities for the needy
thread.title_full: Group sets up racks of blessings at mosques Shelves filled with necessities for the needy

author: NABILA AHMAD
title: Group sets up racks of blessings at mosques Shelves filled with necessities for the needy
text:
by nabila ahmad Job done: The Gerobok Rezeki team posing with the rack they set up at the surau in Kampung Melayu, Gelang Patah. 
JOHOR BARU: A group of volunteers have set up racks filled with food and other necessities at several mosques and surau in Johor. 
Project Gerobok Rezeki (racks of blessings), which Jeffri Senin started in December last year, provides items such as rice, sugar, flour, condensed milk, cooking oil, baby formula and diapers for those in need. 
The self-employed Jeffri, 36, said at least eight volunteers would manage the racks at each location to ensure they are well-stocked. 
“Whenever a person takes an item from the rack, they are required to write down their details in a log book provided.” 
“This is for us to identify the hardcore poor,” he said in an interview. 
Jeffri said his team would submit the details of these individuals to the state Welfare Department. 
Since the programme was launched, he said the team has received positive feedback from the public. 
“We often get calls and thank you notes from the recipients, including those who said that they only wished to take the goods temporarily as they were facing financial hardship at the moment,” he said. 
Some recipients, he said, replenished the supply after taking some items earlier. 
Jeffri said his team would expand the project to cover more areas. 
He encouraged the public to donate, saying that those who want to take part could contact him at https://www.facebook.com/jeffri.senin.12.
